newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Banco Venezolano de Credito ADR issue approved.
newsitem.headline: Banco Venezolano de Credito ADR issue approved.

text.p: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has approved Venezuelan bank Banco Venezolano de Credito's plans to issue Level One American Depository Receipts (ADRs), the bank said Thursday.
A bank official said the ADR issue, in which one ADR will be equivalent to one common share, will be carried out shortly.
Banco Venezolano de Credito said in a release that Bank of New York Co Inc would as depository agent for the ADRs.
Banco Venezolano de Credito shares closed up 100.00 bolivars at 21,700.00 bolivars on the Caracas Stock Exchange Thursday.
Oscar Garca Mendoza, the bank's president, told Reuters he was delighted that Venezolano de Credito had become the first Venezuelan bank to have an ADR issue authorized.
"It is very important for our shareholders since it gives them a much larger market and positions us in the international markets," he said.
The bank recently decided to double its authorized capital to 8.64 billion bolivars ($18.2 million) through a one-for-one share dividend.
